question.text: Has the correct location and area been identified?
Have all the potential Hazards been identified?
Have all the appropriate Controls been identified?
Was the correct level of risk assessment used?
Has a pre-job site visit been completed by the Performing Authority or Issuing Authority?
Have all the correct approval signatures been given for this Permit?
Have all the Pre-Requisite controls specified been put in place?
Has the Performing Authority held a pre-job Toolbox Talk with the work party?
Do the work party demonstrate an adequate level of awareness of the task?
Is the Permit at worksite and signed by all members of the work party?
Can the work party demonstrate an adequate level of awareness of the Hazards associated with the task?
Can the work party demonstrate an adequate level of awareness of the Control measures that are required to safely perform the task?
If the work party identified any further Hazards and/or Controls associated with the task, have they Stopped the job and consulted with the Issuing Authority to update the permit?
Have the appropriate gas and environmental tests been carried out and recorded?
If a COSHH or MSDS assessment is in use, do the members of the work party understand what action to take if a spill or release takes place?
If safety equipment (gas detectors) is included in the risk assessment, do all members of the work party know how to use it?
Have any personnel, who have joined the work party in addition to the original members, been briefed by PA on task and associated Hazards & Controls measures?
Are the existing HV/LV Isolation Procedures accurate?
Do the completed HV/LV isolation documents match with the switch room log books
Does the switch room log book contain all the appropriate signatures?
Do the current isolations comply with the electrical safety guidelines?
Are the records for the electrical drawings accurate? Specifically are marked-up drawings following completion of any recent modifications available?
Have any start-up problems from a previous power loss been addressed?
Is the Certificate of Authorisation register accurate?
Have all the potential Hazards been identified?
Have all the appropriate Controls been identified?
Is the current risk assessment suitable for work on or near live conductors?
Has a pre-job site visit been completed by the Performing Authority or Issuing Authority?
Have all the correct approval signatures been given for this Permit?
Do the local mark-up drawings match with the master drawings?
Has the Responsible Electrical Person reviewed the completion of external training by the authorised persons?
Are the calibration details of the electrical test equipment current?
Is the cleanliness and condition of the electrical switch rooms acceptable?
Are warning signs fixed to all the required points?
Are all spare Motor Control Centre starters or feeders isolated?
Is any electrical safety equipment suitable?
Was the Plant/System clearly identified?
Has the reason for isolation been fully defined?
Does the isolation comply with the BG isolation standard?
Has a level 2 risk assessment been completed if isolation does not meet standard?
Has an engineering solution been sought to ensure compliance with standard?
Has a full description been provided for each isolation point?
Have any LO/LC valves been identified in the ICC?
Is a fully marked up P&ID drawing provided? Is the drawing up to date and showing the location of each isolation point?
Have all the correct approval signatures been given for this ICC?
Are the Isolation Authorities in the site register of competency?
Has each isolation point been identified and labelled?
Has each isolation lock number been recorded?
Has each isolation been secured to the highest realistic standard?
Have the process bleed points been labelled?
Have PBU measurements been taken within the required frequency?
If any alteration has been made to the isolation, has an adequate explanation been made and recorded?
Has action been taken to try to remove this ICC from LTI since its last review or audit?
Has this ICC in LTI been reviewed and audited within the correct periods?
Has each isolation lock number been recorded correctly and the key held in the Key Safe?
Is the Task Description understandable?
Has the correct location and area been identified?
Is the Repair or Work Order in the integrated plan?
Has a start date been identified for the Repair or Work Order?
Is the Repair or Work Order on time?
Have the required spares parts been ordered?
Have the spare parts got a delivery date?
Is the spare parts delivery currently on time?
Have the required equipment checks been carried out?
Has vendor support been Identified and requested?
Is vendor support currently being provided?
Are all of the identified controls needed currently in place?
Are the identified controls being recorded in the correct manner
Is this the first ORA raised for this issue?
Are the P&ID drawings current?
Was the LOLC requirement clearly identified, e.g. on P&IDs, in the LOLC register?
Has the reason for the LOLC requirement been fully defined in the LOLC register?
Does the LOLC arrangement comply with the BG Safe Plant and Equipment Isolation Standard?
Is the locking device actually in place?
If the locking device is missing, is there evidence of authorisation for this and/or documented level 2 risk to support this?
Is the lock type in accordance with the standard and if not is there evidence of authorisation and dispensation in place?

Where the lock relates to instrument or safety critical device isolation, is the locking intent maintained in instrument (rather than piping) isolation forming part of the same system (e.g. both piping and instrument isolation valves on a safety critical trip instrument would be LO)?
Has an engineering solution been sought to ensure compliance with the standard?
Is the target valve number tag and valve size/type clear in the register and evident on the valve itself?
Is the pertinent P&ID and line number identified in the register?
Is the normal lock position clear in the register and is this status reflected on the valve itself?
If valve status in the field does not match the register, is there evidence of authorisation to change status?
Has a full description been provided in the register as to the purpose for the locking, e.g. what hazard does the locking prevent or what protection does it ensure availability for?
Has the lock requirement been classified in accordance with the Operations Lock Open Lock Close Standard (HOLD) and is the classification and reasoning understood?
Does the register indicate what minimum mitigations are required in order to change the valve or locking status?
Is there evidence of historical authorisation approvals and reinstatement confirmations for changes in locking status?
If the status is currently changed (other than normal), is it evident from the register, and in the field, that the minimum required mitigations have been implemented?
Has the LOLC register and implementation been reviewed and audited within the correct periods?
Have all the correct approval signatures been given for LOLC movements?

confirmationMessage.text: All audit checks have been completed.
